text: King Faisal Hospital is the biggest hospital in Rwanda. It is in the Rwandan capital, Kigali. It was built between 1987 and 1991 with the help of the Saudi Fund for Development. The hospital spreads over 7.9 hectares. It has 18,000 square meters of floor space on 4 floors and an extension building of 2,285 square meters of floor space. There are 160 beds and 5 operating theatres. The hospital has a range of highly specialized medical care, including the diagnosis of diseases and specialized treatment. There is a catheterization lab and an MRI digital scanner. ==References== Category:Medical and health organisations based in Rwanda Category:Hospitals
title: King Faisal Hospital (Kigali)
